body:
Hello everyone.

Over the past few weeks, the senior staff have been discussing possible ways to improve the efficiency of the staff team. 
We came up with an alteration of Howsie22's idea (which was to originally to demote all staff (including Directors, and then re-promoting the worthy ones)). However, only the Moderator team will be affected (Junior Moderators & Map Developers are excluded). 

Essentially, this is how it's going to work:
1) Demote all mods, to a regular rank.
2) Opinionated discussion
3) Senior Staff will mark each moderator, privately.
4) Dig deep into evidence that may or may not effect the fate of the staff member being discussed.
5) Finalize the data in which the senior staff has completed.
6) Take action; promote the moderators who passed. Permanently demote the ones who didn't.

This process will take up to 2-3 hours, depending on the efficiency of the senior staff. 

This will occur @ 6PM EST Saturday 29th (9AM AEST Sunday 30th). 

Can you make a difference?
Potentially, yes. If you have any complaints on a staff member, please log onto Teamspeak and search for this: http://prntscr.com/5az38a

All senior staff who will be participating in this event will be available. Do not troll us with pokes, as you will be punished for it. We will consider all evidence provided, as long as it's suffice. 
 
Thanks,
Senior Staff
body_tagged:
Hello everyone.

Over the past few weeks, the senior staff have been discussing possible ways to improve the efficiency of the staff team. 
We came up with an alteration of Howsie22's idea (which was to originally to demote all staff (including Directors, and then re-promoting the worthy ones)). However, only the Moderator team will be affected (Junior Moderators & Map Developers are excluded). 

Essentially, this is how it's going to work:
1) Demote all mods, to a regular rank.
2) Opinionated discussion
3) Senior Staff will mark each moderator, privately.
4) Dig deep into evidence that may or may not effect the fate of the staff member being discussed.
5) Finalize the data in which the senior staff has completed.
6) Take action; promote the moderators who passed. Permanently demote the ones who didn't.

This process will take up to 2-3 hours, depending on the efficiency of the senior staff. 

This will occur @ 6PM EST Saturday 29th (9AM AEST Sunday 30th). 

Can you make a difference?
Potentially, yes. If you have any complaints on a staff member, please log onto Teamspeak and search for this: http://prntscr.com/5az38a

All senior staff who will be participating in this event will be available. Do not troll us with pokes, as you will be punished for it. We will consider all evidence provided, as long as it's suffice. 
 
Thanks,
Senior Staff

replies.body: The reason the Sr.Staff aren't taking part in this and most likely aren't going to in the future, is because we basically already went through this to achieve Sr.Staff. We had to go through an interview stage testing if we had what it took to move up to Sr.Mod. So technically, the Sr.Mods who were recently promoted (myself included) have basically gone through this already. The only difference is that we weren't brought down to a regular rank before we did the interview.

replies.body: Regarding favoritism, I created a written test that each Moderator will need to complete, and test scores do matter. It consists of 10 questions every Moderator should know. Their results play a huge role in whether they keep their rank or not, as well as a group decision between all of the Sr.Staff. I don't think bias will be playing a role here.

replies.body: However with the amount of people taking part in the decision, it's based off of majority. So if a staff member has 4 votes yes and 3 votes no, it would lean toward the yes side of the decision. That could be seen as bias, in a way. But I agree, there's no way to completely be rid of bias decisions. One person could be saying yes because "Oh I know them personally and they're a really nice person" or "They're very efficient in the way they perform their duties as staff, for example.." We can't control how others think. So in a way I guess I have to agree.
replies.body_tagged: However with the amount of people taking part in the decision, it's based off of majority. replies.body:
Guys, what Jozz means, is it'll be as unbiased as (as Iron said) human characteristics can let us get to. Although it's difficult to be 100% unbiased, it's still easy to be unbiased, to the point where if there is bias, it's doesn't completely change the outcome. 

I don't have any doubts about this, and how it'll go. I think things will run smoothly, because of how many people are involved in the decision. Even if 1 staff member had bias, the other may not. Remember, majority rules.

replies.body:
I'm crying and at the same time saying yay! to myself....
Because good moderators and mods whom I loved are now gone,
but also some bad moderators I hated are gone, so I'm very happy and very sad..... :\
Good job to everyone who passed, and my condolences to all those people who isn't mod anymore. Thank you for work hard on Avicus.

Thank you, staff. We will never forget you all who didn't pass, and congratulations to all who passed.

I'm really glad to all the staff. Thank you for work hard on maintain and moderate Avicus, and make it a better place for all.. :)
